intro: Ligusticum dissectum, commonly known as the Japanese parsley or Japanese celery, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It features finely dissected, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots are valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Ligusticum dissectum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
